author: Special Correspondent
text:
All India Anna Dravida Munnetra Kazhagam general secretary and Chief Minister Jayalalithaa on Monday replaced the party’s Information Technology wing secretary ‘Aspire’ K. Swaminathan with G. Ramachandran, an alumnus of the Indian Institute of Management (Ahmedabad).

Mr. Ramachandran, a resident of Coimbatore, is the son of former AIADMK MLA Singai Govindarasu.

An engineering graduate, he chose to join the party after completing his MBA last year.

“I did not opt for campus placement because I wanted to work for Amma . I feel more responsible now,” he said.

In October last, the party’s IT wing launched Mission234, a campaign to tap the votes of the younger generation. It began with a simple video and a slogan – Olirum Nikazhkalam, Milirum Varungkalam (Glowing present, glittering future) – across various social networking platforms, including Twitter, Facebook and YouTube.

The campaign saw several phases. Ms. Jayalalithaa had established the IT wing in February 2014.
title: AIADMK IT wing secretary replaced
